entry.title: Re: SAP S/4HANA for Group Reporting - Introducing New Rules for Automatic Postings
entry.content:
Hello Gregoire,
Just one question that with "Assign multiple document types in one task", how could the audit be achieved? We know that before this new rule feature, each task including custom task BADI, is assigned a unique document type to track the posting (Standard Currency Translation leverages CT Indicator, ANI leverages document type 05 or 0F). With this new feature, customer need to combine task id plus document type to locate the posting behavior?

Best Regards,
Hengye

entry.title: Geographical dimensions and hierarchies in new SAC datamodels
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I am simply looking to understand them when importing a local Excel file for now.

My main interrogation is about the geographical dimensions. With the classic model, you simply had to click the icon 'Geo enrichment', then choose Coordinates or Area Name, then select the corresponding columns, and you basically had your geographical dimension.

In the new model, the only way I found to do this is by adding the properties 'Latitude' and 'Longitude', to the dimension, which automatically creates a dimension table, and transforms it into a valid geographical dimension.

The first question : Is that the only way to do it in the new type of model ?

So now I have my cities geo enriched with the coordinates, but I would like to add a hierarchy on top of that, to maybe be able to dig in a geo map. (Go from continent, to country, to city for instance)

I can't figure out how to do this right now, do I have to create the hierarchy before ? But then I can't create the dimension table necessary for the coordinates.

My second question would be : Is it possible to have a geographical dimension with a level-hierarchy in the new models ?

I am just trying to make sure I did not miss some new functionnality.

Have a great day !

entry.title: Security related ATC checks, nonsense of pseudo comments
entry.content:
Hi all,

I want to use ATC security checks to identify certain security vulnerables like usage of GENERATE REPORT, GENERATE SUBROUINE POOL and others. I found there are already ATC checks available for, but they can be easily suppressed by pseudo comment

"#EC CI_GENERATE.

In my opinion, it absolutely makes no sense to be able supress certain ATC checks by pseudo comments. In some cases it makes sense (like BAPI call with material length check). But for security related topics, it is dangerous in my opinion. Instead, ATC exemption should be used for this imo.

If you employ unfriendly/enemy developers (i.e., by external partner), they simply add pseudo comments to cheat on ATC check. This makes it more challenging in identifying vulnerable code as I can't trust ATC checks here.

Is there a way to overcome this issue (beside replacing developers)

entry.title: Re: BDCQ - Finance - Needs to be in sync with SAP Best Pr...
entry.content:
Hello @KP_2025 

Gathering Responses in the Business Driven Configuration Questionnaire can be challenging, but this SAP Learning Gathering Responses in the Business Driven Configuration Questionnaire (BDCQ) Will be very helpful

The BDCQ helps collect configuration values that you will later enter into SAP Central Business Configuration.

Within BDCQ, configuration experts utilise the Scope Reference (scope item ID) from the DDA to filter relevant business processes. This is done with L2 questions prior to Fit-to-Standard and L3 questions during workshops, confirming that scope item IDs are the key link for mapping requirements.  You can refer to the SAP Learning link above

What are the best practices for SAP S/4HANA Cloud in the Finance Line of Business? There are subgroups, such as Accounting & Financial Close, Advanced Financial Operations, and Enterprise Risk & Compliance, among others. Scope items fall under these. SAP Press Blog

Let me know if you need further information.

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: BYD2508 Remove old partner contanct
entry.content:
Hi Community,

In SAP Business By Design, direct removal of a partner contact is not supported in the system UI, as this data is centrally managed with your subscription.

As outlined in KBA 3017227 ‚Äì Removal of SAP Partner Contact, such requests are not handled by SAP Product Support. Please contact your SAP Account Manager, Customer Engagement Executive (CEE), or Customer Success Manager (CSM) to perform this change.

These roles are responsible for assisting with customer master data and subscription-related activities.

We appreciate your understanding and cooperation. If you have any further questions, please feel free to reach out ‚Äî we are happy to help.

 

Kind regards,

Arpita Joshi

SAP Product Support

Community:

SAP Business ByDesign:https://www.sap.com/community/topics/business-bydesign.html

entry.title: Re: I can see application job template but not able to se...
entry.content:
Hello,

I had this same issue a while ago. Every time you create an Application Job Template, an IAM App with the suffix _SAJC is automatically created.

What you need to do is create a Business Catalog and associate this app with it, in eclipse ADT. Then, go to your S/4HANA instance and associate this business catalog with a Business Role that your user has.

Please refer this link: https://help.sap.com/docs/sap-btp-abap-environment/abap-environment/setting-up-authorizations

After that, you should be able to run it.

Kind Regards,

Marcelo Romeiro

entry.title: Re: Cannot create support case for SFSF cloud system
entry.content:
Dear Customer,

The following KBA contains the necessary authorizations for creating or viewing support cases for SFSF systems in SAP for Me.

2193754 S-user is unable to create or view SuccessFactors support cases - SAP for Me

In case of missing authorizations, the affected system cannot be selected.

If your S-User has any of the mentioned authorizations on INSTALL level, check the installation number of the system which is missing. In such a case you need the authorizations assigned for the affected installation number as well.

Example:

there are the following SFSF installations under customer number X:

instA

SFSFsystemA1

SFSFsystemA2

instB

SFSFsystemB1

SFSFsystemB2

instC

SFSFsystemC1

If an S-User has the authorizations on INSTALL level for instA and instB, but not for instC, the user will not be able to see system "SFSFsystemC1" upon opening a case.

In order to gain the necessary authorization, kindly reach out to your Cloud Admin or request them in SAP for Me as described here:

2891528 How to use the Self-Service Authorization Request - SAP for Me

Kind regards,

SAP Support

entry.title: Notification Channel Configuration (Fiori Launchpad) - Embedded Scenario
entry.content:
The goal of this blog post is to make it possible to receive notifications in Fiori Launchpad (the bell icon) with the hub and the backend on the same ABAP server instance ("Embedded scenario")

It copies the texts from different chapters of the SAP Help Portal, but if you prefer there are more comprehensive documents here:

  • SAP Learning tutorial: Configuring Notifications
    • It's derived from this non-official document by SAP employee: How to Setup Notifications in Fiori 2.0 step-by-step in S/4HANA 1809 or before, most of them are still relevant today.
  • This other blog post on the same topic as mine: Fiori Launchpad - Notification Configuration - SAP Community, but I have added references to SAP Help Portal, and some activities were useless (like bgRFC activities), and I removed the chapter about configuring SAP Business Workflow for the Notification Channel.

It's enriched with some screenshots (70% of them copied from the blog post above).

We'll go in the customizing of these 3 SAP Help books:

  1. Notifications are based on OData version 4. For SAP Gateway Foundation for OData version 4 (V4) you need to activate ICF node /sap/opu/odata4.

     

  2. Authorizations required. SAP provides a default catalog that contains the relevant target mapping for conveniently enabling notifications in SAP Fiori launchpad: /UI2/CONFIG_NOTIFICATION.
  3. Notification Channel: it describes most of the configurations needed, the below chapters in red are covered.

 

Enable all OData version 4 services (links to SAP Help Portal: OData V4 service name and activating)

Notifications are based on OData version 4. For SAP Gateway Foundation for OData version 4 (V4) you need to activate ICF node /sap/opu/odata4.

Run T-code SICF.

Enter "/sap/opu/odata4" in the Service Path field and click Execute button.

 

Enabling Notifications in the Launchpad (link to SAP Help Portal)

SAP provides a default catalog that contains the relevant target mapping for conveniently enabling notifications in SAP Fiori launchpad: /UI2/CONFIG_NOTIFICATION. By assigning this default catalog to user roles you can quickly configure notifications for your launchpad users.

Go to Transaction PFCG and create the role Z_PUSH_NOTIFICATION.

Go to Launchpad Catalog in the Transaction Button.

Enter Catalog ID as /UI2/CONFIG_NOTIFICATION and click on Continue.

 

Embedded Scenario (link to SAP Help Portal)

Notification Channel Provider Enablement Configuration

All the configuration steps are available in the SAP Reference IMG in the SAP Implementation Guide (IMG) in transaction SPRO under SAP Customizing Implementation Guide > SAP NetWeaver > Notification Channel > Notification Channel Provider Enablement.

  1. In the IMG navigate to Notification Channel Provider Enablement > Configuration > Connection Settings > Enter the Notification Hub RFC Destination and execute the activity.

    Enter NONE (as HUB and BEP are configured in the same system).

  2. In the IMG navigate to Notification Channel Provider Enablement > Configuration > Connection Settings > Enter the Backend System Alias and execute the activity.

    Enter LOCAL and execute to set the value.


  3. This activity is optional because all standard Notification Providers are already defined. It's only needed if you want to publish your own providers, or some standard ones are missing.
    In the IMG navigate to Notification Channel Provider Enablement > Administration > Notification Provider Settings > Register Notification Providers and execute the activity.

    Enter the Provider ID, the Provider Class name and description and save your settings.

    Provider IDClassDescriptionUsage
    SAP_BUSINESS_WORKFLOWCL_SWF_PUSH_NOTIF_PROVIDERBusiness Workflow Notification ProviderTo get Workflow workitems in the Fiori Notifications
    /IWNGW/DEMO/IWNGW/CL_DEMO_NOTIF_PROVIDERAny description you want e.g., Demo Notification ProviderNot part of standard delivery. Described in Demo Content | SAP Help Portal. although the ID and Class are missing!

     

  4. In the IMG navigate to Notification Channel Provider Enablement > Administration > Notification Provider Settings > Manage Notification Providers and execute the activity.

Notification Channel Hub Configuration

All the configuration steps are available in the SAP Reference IMG in the SAP Implementation Guide (IMG) in transaction SPRO under SAP Customizing Implementation Guide > SAP NetWeaver > Notification Channel > Notification Channel Hub.

  1. Create an SAP system alias called LOCAL, RFC destination to NONE.

    In the IMG navigate to Configuration > Connection Settings > Manage SAP System Aliases and execute the activity.

    If a LOCAL system alias with RFC destination set to NONE does not exist, create it with description Local System Alias.



     
  2. To publish the notification channel OData service:

    In the IMG navigate to Configuration > Connection Settings > Publish the Notification OData Service and execute the activity.


    If the Notification Channel Service Group with ID /IWNGW/NOTIFICATION does not exist, publish it.
    1. Under System Alias enter LOCAL and choose /IWNGW/NOTIFICATION in Service Group ID.
    2. Choose Get Service Groups.
    3. Select the /IWNGW/NOTIFICATION Group ID and choose Publish Service Groups.

  3. Add push functionality so that it can be used in the SAP Fiori launchpad. For more information, see Push Channel Settings.
    SEE BELOW
  4. Add push functionality so that it can be used in SAP Mobile Platform. For more information, see Add Push for Use with SAP Mobile Platform.
    NOT NEEDED IN MY CASE
  5. Activate sensitive data cache so that sensitive information is encrypted. For more information, see Activate Sensitive Data Cache and Data Encryption.
    NOT NEEDED IN MY CASE

 

Push Channel Settings (link to SAP Help Portal)

In this section you can find information about adding push functionality so that it can be used in the SAP Fiori launchpad. The activities are available in the SAP Implementation Guide (IMG) in transaction SPRO under SAP Customizing Implementation Guide  SAP NetWeaver   Notification Channel   Notification Channel Hub.

  1. Activate the WebSocket Endpoint:

    In the IMG navigate to Configuration > Configuration Settings > Manage WebSocket Endpoint.

    •  

    Enter NOTIFICATION_PUSH_APC as Service Name and choose Execute.

    Select NOTIFICATION_PUSH_APC and choose Activate in the context menu.

  2. Activate WebSocket Push Channel:

    In the IMG navigate to SAP Netweaver > Notification Channel > Notification Channel Hub > Administration > Push Channel Settings > Activate and Maintain Push Channels and execute the activity.

    Choose New Entries to create a new record and enter SAP_WEBSOCKET as Push Channel ID. Specify the sequence number, for example, 10, as the sequence in which the push channel will be processed.

    Activate Is Active? and save your settings.

 

Notification Channel User Roles and Authorizations (link to SAP Help Portal)

The Notification Channel framework provides predefined roles as templates for developers, administrators, end users and so-called provider users. You configure the roles based on the provided templates and assign users to the roles.

The role templates specify the authorizations for content that can be accessed by users of the specific consumer application, for example the notification panel in the SAP Fiori launchpad or administrative transactions within the implementation guide (IMG).

You can find more information abut how to use role templates in Creating and Assigning Roles from Templates.

The following role templates are available in transaction PFGC.

PFCG Role TemplatesTemplate NameDescription

/IWNGW/RT_BEP_ADM

Role template for Notification Channel back-end administrator

/IWNGW/RT_HUB_ADM

Role template for Notification Channel hub administrator

/IWNGW/RT_NP_DEV

Role template for Notification Channel developer

/IWNGW/RT_USER_CONSU

Role template for Notification Channel consumer user

/IWNGW/RT_USER_PRODU

Role template for Notification Channel producer user

For more information, refer to the SAP Help Portal which describes precisely all the role templates above.

Below is an example with the template /IWNGW/RT_NP_DEV, and the role will be Z_PUSH_NOTIFICATION.

If the role already exists

Go to Change Authorizations, then select the menu Edit > Insert authorization(s) > From template

 

If the role doesn't exist yet:

 

Demo Content (link to SAP Help Portal)

To test the demo provider proceed as follows:

    1. To activate Demo Provider on your system, go to SPRO  SAP NetWeaver > Notification Channel Provider Enablement > Administration > Notification Provider Settings > Manage Notification Providers.

      See step 7 in Hub deployment for reference. (not needed)

      It's missing the very important information that the provider ID /IWNGW/DEMO (no other name is possible) is to be created with the class /IWNGW/CL_DEMO_NOTIF_PROVIDER.

      Alternatively, you can use transaction SM30 and the view /IWNGW/VB_REG_P to activate Demo Provider.

    2. Run transaction /IWNGW/BEP_DEMO and trigger a leave request, for example.

 

  1. Start the SAP Fiori launchpad on your frontend server and verify that the notifications have been created.

  2. The notification should arrive almost instantly, as the launchpad is notified via a web socket connection once the notification instances are created.

In the upgraded system, all requests for files from sap/bc/ui5_ui5/ui2/ushell/resources/ are responding in hundreds of milliseconds where the older NetWeaver serves respond in sub 100ms.

We have observed that the ICM cache does not appear to store files from ushell/resources in S/4HANA where they are in NW AS ABAP 7.52. 

Has anyone else observed this?

entry.title: Profit centre not inherited to all lines of a document despite being a Doc Splitting Characteristic?
entry.content:
Profit Centre is included as a Document Splitting Characteristic by default (though not as zero balancing characteristic), so we expect that PC will be inherited to all lines of the document from the Revenue Line or Expense Line.


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Profit centre not inherited to all lines of a documen...
entry.content:
Despite the fact Profit Centre is delivered as a standard Document Splitting characteristic, it is not automatically enforced in the same way as zero-balancing characteristics.

As per SAP Help documentation, ‚ÄúSometimes the system can‚Äôt determine the account assignments of the document splitting characteristics for individual line items. In this case, the account assignments are determined either by inheritance or by using a standard account assignment, if the required information isn‚Äôt available when you make a posting.‚Äù

This means that Profit Centre values are normally inherited from source line items (for example, expense or revenue), but if the system cannot derive a value, the result can differ depending on configuration or timing.

Thanks. The (bad case) trace does not show any problem. It just stops in the middle of an array fetch operation after fetching a large amount of data. Looks like in the good case the application just continues fetching data.

The trace may not have been completely flushed.
Could you please (temporarily) add "TraceFlush=false;" to the additional attributes of your DSN definition and repeat the bad trace?

The query you are executing does not touch any of the code areas fixed with PL22 . So it may be pure (bad) luck that you found this now.
Regards
                       Frank

entry.title: Round up to 2 decimal places - Compensation Worksheets
entry.content:
We are looking into rounding up the finalsalary amounts up to 2 decimal places. 

Based on the notes in SAP Help Guide, there is an option to change the rounding rules for "defAmountformat" in the compensation template > Set Number Format Rules. We tried to select "Up" for Multiple Rounding Mode, however, it won't save until you set a value in the "Multiple" field. 

I raised a ticket to SAP support to confirm what value we should set in "multiple" field in order to round up the final salary to 2 decimal places, and was suggested to use "0.01", however this is not accepted in the system.

Based on the SAP Help guide, below are the only acceptable values for the said field.

  1. Multiple value can't be less than 0.
  2. Multiple value can't be 1.
  3. Multiple value can't be string.
  4. Multiple value can't have a decimal point.

Having this said, has anyone had a similar requirement? If yes, how did you resolve it? Any advice is highly appreciated.

entry.title: üöÄ SAP BTP: integraci√≥n inteligente, control financiero y sostenibilidad
entry.content:
Expansi√≥n de SAP BTP hacia los marketplaces de hyperscalers (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud)

SAP ha anunciado que algunos servicios de SAP BTP estar√°n disponibles en los hyperscaler marketplaces en la segunda mitad de 2025. Esto permite que clientes compren y consuman servicios de BTP directamente desde AWS Marketplace, Azure Marketplace, etc., lo que puede simplificar licenciamiento y despliegue. Mejora la flexibilidad en d√≥nde ejecutar servicios, y posiblemente reduzca latencias si se usan infraestructuras cercanas. Tambi√©n implica que los equipos de finanzas deber√°n adaptarse a nuevos modelos de facturaci√≥n. Los clientes podr√°n elegir entre usar BTP desde SAP directamente o v√≠a Marketplace.

Ventajas: m√°s agilidad al aprovisionar servicios, posiblemente mejores acuerdos comerciales locales, menor fricci√≥n operativa, alineaci√≥n con estrategias multicloud/h√≠bridas.

üîó Mas informaci√≥n / https://azuremarketplace.microsoft.com/es-es/marketplace/apps/sapus.btp_us?tab=overview

Nuevas capacidades en SAP HANA Cloud: migraci√≥n selectiva de objetos, gobernanza de costos y monitoreo granular

Se han anunciado mejoras de HANA Cloud que permiten migrar objetos espec√≠ficos de base de datos de un HANA on-premise o cl√°sico hacia HANA Cloud de forma selectiva (no toda la base). Tambi√©n habr√° mayor visibilidad del consumo, gobernanza financiera y monitoreo m√°s granular del uso de recursos. Esto facilita planes de modernizaci√≥n (‚Äòclean core‚Äô) al permitir mover por piezas. Mejora del control de costos operacionales, menor riesgo de sobredimensionamiento. Ideal para empresas que quieren innovar poco a poco.

Ventajas: menos riesgo al migrar; se puede hacer roll-out gradual; permite optimizar qu√© partes de datos o sistemas conviene mover al cloud; optimizaci√≥n del gasto.

üîó Mas informaci√≥n

SAP Customer Identity and Access Management (CIAM) disponible en SAP BTP bajo el Enterprise Agreement

CIAM (Customer Identity & Access Management) ahora est√° incluido como parte de SAP BTP bajo el contrato Enterprise Agreement. Esto aporta una soluci√≥n multitenant, cloud-nativa para manejar identidades de clientes o socios, cumplimiento, privacidad y personalizaci√≥n. Reduce la necesidad de soluciones externas de identidad. Mejora la seguridad de datos de clientes y la experiencia de usuario. Puede alinearse con regulaciones europeas, latinoamericanas, etc., para gesti√≥n de consentimiento y protecci√≥n de datos.

Ventajas: menos componentes externos, integraci√≥n m√°s directa con otras herramientas de SAP, potencial reducci√≥n de coste de licenciamiento externo, mayor coherencia en pol√≠ticas de identidad, visibilidad y auditor√≠a centralizadas.

üîó Mas informaci√≥n

Extensibility Wizard‚Äù para SAP Build y extensiones guiadas desde SAP Business Suite / SAP S/4HANA

SAP ha introducido un Extensibility Wizard (asistente de extensibilidad) que gu√≠a el desarrollo de extensiones tanto para SAP Business Suite como para SAP S/4HANA Cloud. Esto ayuda a estandarizar la forma de extender aplicaciones, asegurando que las extensiones sean compatibles con futuras actualizaciones. Facilita que equipos menos experimentados con ABAP o con extension-points sigan buenas pr√°cticas. Reduce el riesgo de ‚Äúcustom code spaghetti‚Äù. Puede acelerar entregas menores/incrementales sin comprometer el core.

Ventajas: menor tiempo de desarrollo, menos errores, mayor mantenibilidad, mejor preparaci√≥n para upgrades, posibilidad de que las extensiones sean menos costosas de mantener.

üîó Mas informaci√≥n

Integraciones nuevas-predefinidas / adapters adicionales en SAP Integration Suite

SAP Integration Suite est√° incorporando nuevos adapters (conectores) para tecnolog√≠as como IBM MQ, Google Cloud Storage, Salesforce PubSub, Anaplan, Snowflake, etc. Esto ampl√≠a la capacidad out-of-the-box de conectar SAP con sistemas modernos de datos, aplicaciones SaaS, servicios de mensajer√≠a. Se suma la mejora de experiencia de usuario para descubrir contenido preconstruido, recomendaciones, etc. Facilita integraciones h√≠bridas o entre SAP y no-SAP con menor customizaci√≥n.

Ventajas: ahorro de tiempo, mayor estandarizaci√≥n, menor probabilidad de errores en adaptadores hechos a medida, mantenimiento m√°s sencillo. Tambi√©n reduce la barrera para integrar nuevos partners o servicios externos.

üîó Mas informaci√≥n

Mejoras de visibilidad y gobernanza financiera / monitoreo de consumo en los servicios de BTP

SAP est√° reforzando las herramientas de monitoreo del consumo, visibilidad de costos y gobernanza financiera en SAP BTP, especialmente para HANA Cloud, integraci√≥n, servicios que consumen recursos. Esto permite a las empresas anticipar gastos (‚Äúforecast‚Äù) y evitar sorpresas en uso excesivo. Mejores dashboards, alertas, m√©tricas m√°s finas de uso, consumo por objeto o servicio, etc. Tambi√©n se alinea con pol√≠ticas internas de presupuestos, auditor√≠as y optimizaci√≥n de costos.

Ventajas: mayor previsibilidad financiera, identificaci√≥n temprana de cuellos de botella o servicios sub-utilizados, optimizaci√≥n del gasto, facilitar decisiones de cierre vs extensi√≥n del servicio.

üîó Mas informaci√≥n

Estrategia de sostenibilidad con SAP BTP: Control Tower, Footprint Management y Green Ledger

SAP est√° reforzando su portafolio de sostenibilidad, con herramientas como SAP Sustainability Control Tower, Sustainability Footprint Management y SAP Green Ledger, integradas con SAP BTP y SAP S/4HANA Cloud. Estas soluciones permiten capturar datos ESG (ambientales, sociales y de gobierno), automatizar reportes, calcular huella de carbono por producto, y llevar m√©tricas de sostenibilidad al mismo nivel que los reportes financieros. Para organizaciones con regulaci√≥n creciente en est√°ndares ESG, estas capacidades ayudan a cumplir normativas como CSRD y similares, adem√°s de mejorar reputaci√≥n.

Ventajas: visibilidad centralizada de datos ESG, capacidad de reacci√≥n ante exigencias regulatorias, posibilidad de incorporar responsabilidades ambientales en decisiones operativas, v√≠nculo m√°s claro entre sostenibilidad y estrategia de negocio, potencial ahorro a mediano plazo si se optimizan procesos, menos riesgos legales o reputacionales.

üîó Mas informaci√≥n

entry.title: Re: Custom Application Job Template not visible in Applic...
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I'm happy to report that I've found the solution to the problem I was facing with the missing application job template.

The issue was related to authorizations not being properly synchronized. As per SAP Note 3414562, users cannot see application job templates for which they do not have the authorization to execute.

Although I had assigned the corresponding _SAJC app to the business catalog, something was out of sync. To fix this and force a synchronization, I followed these steps:

  1. I removed my user from the relevant Business Role.
  2. I saved the changes.
  3. I added my user back to the same Business Role and saved it again.

This forced update of the user's roles resolved the issue. After this change, not only could I access the job template, but all other users with the same Business Role could also see it.

I hope this helps anyone else facing a similar issue!

Kind Regards,

Marcelo Romeiro

entry.title: Re: SAP Business Data Cloud Series ‚Äì Part 2: Extend SAP S/4HANA Managed Data Products
entry.content:
@Zerosnow : Please refer to step 6 options (Installing a Data Product to an SAP Datasphere Space)

Replication from FOS into SAP Datasphere (HANA Cloud space) is a business-driven decision, typically based on different scenarios such as:

  • Reporting performance: HDFS (FOS) storage and HANA Cloud database deliver different query performance levels, which may influence replication needs.

  • Data consolidation and transformation: Leveraging SAP Datasphere‚Äôs capabilities to unify and enrich data across sources.

In contrast, the Remote Table option enables a federated (zero-copy / delta-share) scenario where data remains in FOS (HDFS) but is accessible in SAP Datasphere.

Note: When a data package is activated, not all data products are automatically available across every Datasphere space. They must be installed for a specific space.

entry.title: Re: Geographical dimensions and hierarchies in new SAC da...
entry.content:
@JulienD_ 

Please see responses below.

The first question : Is that the only way to do it in the new type of model ? Yes

In New model you can only geo enrich by creating attributes of Type latitude and Longitude.

Is it possible to have a geographical dimension with a level-hierarchy in the new models ?

I do not think this is a limitation but haven't personally tried it out. Level based Hierarchy require you to create Level attributes first. So you would need attributes for each level and also Latitude and Longitude properties to geo enrich the dimension.

Hope this helps !

Nikhil

entry.title: Re: SAP SuccessFactors WorkZone Page Load Times
entry.content:
Finally, were able to resolve the issue with the of SAP a few months ago. 
I figured to let everyone know what the exact problem was:
Together with the customer, we introduced a very extensive navigation toolbar which referenced several workspaces.
The essential part here is: Not by URL, but by the inbuilt functionality to reference a workspace in the navigation bar. 

It seemed to be a good idea since it  was setup quite fast and easily. But there is a catch:

The more workspaces you have referenced with this method, the more time the initial loading time will suffer.
A hard reload also brings no improvement because of whats of the following:

When using the inbuilt functionality to reference a workspace in the toolbar, before it is going to be displayed, a permission check is going to be perfomed - for each workspace separately. 
In our case, we had referenced more than 50 work spaces and work pages. So each time an employee and even we opened WorkZone, it would check which areas we are allowed to visit, increasing the loading times drastically. 

The solution: Replace any occurence of workspace references with their direct URL in the navigation bar.. The loading times went down to a fraction of what we had before.
In case someone is not authorized to view a certain workspace, he will get a message saying so, once he is on the page.

entry.title: EUDR Compliance: Why Transactional Traceability Beats Annual Reporting
entry.content:
The EU Deforestation Regulation (EUDR) sets strict requirements for proving commodities like cocoa, palm oil, soy, rubber, cattle, coffee, and timber are deforestation-free. At the heart of this proof are Due Diligence Statements (DDS) submitted into the EU TRACES system.

Some companies still believe they can meet EUDR with a single annual DDS summary covering all volumes. On paper, it looks simpler. In reality, annual reporting under EUDR is risky and error-prone.

Figure 1.  Overview of Inbounds on a Transactional-Level in Green Token

 

Why annual reporting is risky

Annual summaries may sound efficient, but they create major problems:

  • One error risks everything: If one non-compliant shipment is hidden inside an annual DDS, the entire declaration could be invalidated.
  • Delayed detection: Errors or missing data may only surface months later, when corrections are far more costly.
  • Limited traceability: Aggregated, year-end data makes it harder to link individual shipments back to their plots of land, which weakens compliance under Article 9. And since geolocation data must still be collected at the batch level regardless, annual reporting doesn‚Äôt actually reduce the workload, it only increases compliance risk.
  • Volume tracking issues: Annual DDS volumes can ‚Äúexpire‚Äù mid-year if shipments exceed what was declared, forcing emergency resubmissions.
  • Audit challenges: Competent authorities may request evidence for specific shipments. Annual aggregation makes it difficult to provide clear, shipment-level proof on demand.

Annual reporting is not just inefficient, it‚Äôs a compliance risk in itself.

 

The benefits of transactional reporting

Transactional (delivery-level) reporting flips the model: instead of summarizing everything once per year, each shipment carries its own DDS.

This approach delivers four key advantages:

  1. Lower risk
    One problematic shipment doesn‚Äôt compromise an entire year‚Äôs worth of trade.
  2. Real-time compliance
    Errors are flagged immediately, not months later.
  3. Audit-readiness
    Every delivery has its own traceable record, linked to geolocation and supplier data.
  4. Operational agility
    Companies can adjust volumes, swap suppliers, or reroute shipments without breaking their DDS chain.

It‚Äôs no coincidence that the Commission designed TRACES to issue reference numbers per shipment, not per year.

 

 Figure 2. Annual Versus Transactional Reporting

 

How SAP Green Token enables transactional compliance

SAP Green Token is purpose-built to enable transactional reporting at enterprise scale. Not as a bolt-on, but as an ERP-centric solution.

  • ERP-native data capture: Reuse supplier, material, and delivery data already stored in SAP ERP or S/4HANA. No duplicate entry, no shadow systems.
  • Automated DDS generation: Each delivery is automatically mapped, structured, and submitted into TRACES.
  • Built-in TRACES integration: Official DDS reference numbers flow straight back into SAP Green Token, keeping master data and compliance records in sync.
  • Granular chain-of-custody: Tracks commodity flows across multi-tier supply chains, right down to the plot of land. Segregated accounting is enforced by design, which is a mandatory requirement under EUDR.
  • Error prevention through automation: Validation rules check data before submission, reducing the chance of incorrect or missing information.
  • Audit-ready storage: DDS and supporting data are retained securely for at least five years, with transparent reporting at the click of a button.

Instead of a once-a-year scramble, Green Token turns EUDR compliance into a continuous, automated process that fits seamlessly into the systems companies already run.

 

 Figure 3. Closing Overview

 

Why annual reporting is tempting but misleading

Many companies are tempted by the idea of one big annual DDS because:

  • It feels administratively lighter.
  • They assume authorities prefer a single ‚Äústatement of record.‚Äù
  • They hope to ‚Äúbundle‚Äù risk into a once-a-year exercise.

But annual summaries don‚Äôt reflect how EUDR compliance works in practice. TRACES is structured around transactional submissions, and shipment-level traceability is far more practical when it comes to audits, error detection, and day-to-day compliance.

EUDR compliance is about providing reliable, ongoing proof that products are deforestation-free and legally produced. While annual reporting may seem easier, it introduces risk and limits traceability. Transactional reporting, by contrast, reduces risk, improves accuracy, and keeps companies audit-ready throughout the year.

That‚Äôs why SAP Green Token is built for transactional EUDR compliance at scale ‚Äî combining ERP-native data capture, TRACES integration, and real-time auditability.

üëâ Don‚Äôt gamble on annual reporting. Learn more about SAP Green Token here.

entry.title: Re: CrystalDecisions.Shared.CrystalReportsException is no...
entry.content: Can you paste in the new dump info? Did you ask Microsoft how to resolve the error? It is a IIS error, try comparing the settings between your DEV PC and Production PC. Look for multiple web.config files, often there is more than one and that's causing the problem, your app is not loading the web.config from your \bin folder

entry.title: Error message "Service broker privatelink failed with: serviceName: serviceName is a required field"
entry.content:
Hi all,

At this community tutorial, to create a private Link to an Azure service (CosmosDB in my case) : https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-members/sap-private-linky-swear-with-azure-global-scale-with-azure-cosmos-db-and/ba-p/13555267, there is mentioned you need to collect only 1 parameters available in Azure Portal (the ResourceID). Somehow, there is no more the "Form/JSON" tab in the BTP UI, like visible in the screenshots in the middle of the page.

As I can only use a JSON for my instance parameters, so I followed this other SAP tutorial  : https://developers.sap.com/tutorials/private-link-microsoft-azure.html#05d4587b-72e1-4a82-bb70-96227d29d6a5, and when using the GUI, it is advised again to provide a JSON with 1 parameter (Step 3).

But it ends up with error : 

 

> cf create-service privatelink standard privatelink-test -c '{"resourceId":"/subscriptions/someGUID/resourceGroups/somename/providers/Microsoft.DocumentDb/databaseAccounts/mygremlinDB"}'
Creating service instance privatelink-test in org someGUID / space somename as someone@somewhere.com...

Job (c46c63b3-3387-4573-bb0c-13e1587a7fca) failed: provision could not be completed: Service broker error: Service broker privatelink failed with: serviceName: serviceName is a required field
FAILED

 

So I went to the official reference : https://help.sap.com/docs/private-link/private-link1/azure-cosmos-db 

Unfortunately, the JSON seems not valid and the BTP UI replies a very similar message : 

Object is missing the required property 'serviceName'
No additional properties allowed but property resourceId is set
No additional properties allowed but property subResource is set
No additional properties allowed but property cosmosDb is set
No additional properties allowed but property requestMessage is set

Questions : 

  • It seems as if SAP BTP was believing I want to setup a Private Link with AWS and not Azure. Did I overlooked sth? 
  • Why is the "Form" tab in the "New Instance or Subscription" BTP when creating a new Private Link instance, no longer showing "Form" tab?

entry.title: Re: S4HANA Internal Procurement Catalog set up
entry.content: Note: just noting some conversation around internal catalogs. internal catalogs aren't really great in private or public cloud. There is no mass upload or web service i have identified so far. For an actual implementation we suggest to use purchase non-stocked materials and purchase info records or contracts and/or source list to default source of supply for the materials. That you can mass upload with the data migration cockpit. for some reason SAP has not provided a "full" internal catalog functionality, so it's really not good since business winds up having to maintain everything manually...

entry.title: Service Entry Sheet by value
entry.content:
Good morning, support team,

We need to perform service receipts with very specific amounts. We have tried adjusting the unit percentage, but it does not yield the same result.

I have an example where a purchase order was created for the amount of 4,762,414.8125, and six service receipts were made for the following values:

  • 580,357.67

  • 476,241.07

  • 638,392.86

  • 714,285.71

  • 1,266,573.21

  • 1,086,564.29

If we apply a rule of three to extract the percentage for each receipt, the resulting values do not match due to decimal differences.

Is it possible to receive by amount instead of by quantity?
